      • getState

        public com.intellij.ide.lightEdit.LightEditConfiguration getState()
        Specified by:
        getState in interface PersistentStateComponent<com.intellij.ide.lightEdit.LightEditConfiguration>
        Returns:
        a component state. All properties, public and annotated fields are serialized. Only values, which differ from the default (i.e., the value of newly instantiated class) are serialized. null value indicates that the returned state won't be stored, as a result previously stored state will be used.
        See Also:
        XmlSerializer

      • loadState

        public void loadState(com.intellij.ide.lightEdit.LightEditConfiguration state)
        Description copied from interface: PersistentStateComponent
        This method is called when new component state is loaded. The method can and will be called several times, if config files were externally changed while IDE was running.

        State object should be used directly, defensive copying is not required.

        Specified by:
        loadState in interface PersistentStateComponent<com.intellij.ide.lightEdit.LightEditConfiguration>
        Parameters:
        state - loaded component state
        See Also:
        XmlSerializerUtil.copyBean(Object, Object)

      • appClosing

        public void appClosing()
        Description copied from interface: AppLifecycleListener
        Fired before saving settings and before final 'can exit?' check. App may end up not closing if some of the ApplicationListener listeners return false from their canExitApplication method.
        Specified by:
        appClosing in interface AppLifecycleListener
